title: Sine and Cosine - distance between points

content.question: ​Angles <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="B"><semantics><mi>B</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> are in standard position in the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane. The measure of angle <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is <math alttext="fraction numerator 2 pi over denominator 3 end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> radians, and the measure of angle <math alttext="B"><semantics><mi>B</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is <math alttext="fraction numerator 4 pi over denominator 3 end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> radians. The terminal rays of both angles intersect a circle centered at the origin with radius <math alttext="20"><semantics><mn>20</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. What is the distance between these two points of intersection: the circle and terminal ray of angle <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, and the circle and terminal ray of angle <math alttext="B"><semantics><mi>B</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="cos open parentheses fraction numerator 2 pi over denominator 3 end fraction close parentheses minus cos open parentheses fraction numerator 4 pi over denominator 3 end fraction close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="20 cos open parentheses fraction numerator 2 pi over denominator 3 end fraction close parentheses minus 20 cos open parentheses fraction numerator 4 pi over denominator 3 end fraction close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mn>20</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="sin open parentheses fraction numerator 2 pi over denominator 3 end fraction close parentheses minus sin open parentheses fraction numerator 4 pi over denominator 3 end fraction close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="20 sin open parentheses fraction numerator 2 pi over denominator 3 end fraction close parentheses minus 20 sin open parentheses fraction numerator 4 pi over denominator 3 end fraction close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mn>20</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="20 sin open parentheses fraction numerator 2 pi over denominator 3 end fraction close parentheses minus 20 sin open parentheses fraction numerator 4 pi over denominator 3 end fraction close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mn>20</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
